H0.text: Air pollution is the type of pollution most often produced by burning fossil fuels such as oil, coal, and gasoline.

H1.text: Land pollution is the type of pollution most often produced by burning fossil fuels such as oil, coal, and gasoline, a waste product that results from the use of both renewable and nonrenewable natural resources in Maryland and its surrounding area.

H2.text: Noise pollution is the type of pollution most often produced by burning fossil fuels such as oil, coal, and gasoline, even though many natural resources in Maryland and surrounding areas—both renewable and nonrenewable—are used daily and produce waste products.

H3.text: Water pollution is the type of pollution most often produced by burning fossil fuels, such as oil, coal, and gasoline, as noted in the discussion of natural resources in Maryland and the surrounding area.

A4.text: The burning of fossil fuels is the largest source of air pollution deaths.

A5.text: Burning fuel to generate electricity causes air pollution; lignite and coal produce the most air pollution, followed by oil, and then by fossil gas and biomass.
